form_title.ms_form_title_llm_v1: UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE REPORT OF INVESTIGATION

full_text: Screened by NARA, 9/18/2023 UNITED STATES DEPARTMENT OF JUSTICE IMMIGRATION AND NATURALIZATION SERVICE REPORT OF INVESTIGATION TITLE FILE NUMBER WONG, Ben Dong aka WONG, Guck On A12 250 430 REPORT MADE AT DATE BY Los 12/4/68 forth Loyd L Netherlin INVESTIGATOR SYANOPSIS DETAILS: SUBJECT'S file shows his admission to the U. S. at San Pedro, California on 10/21/32 as WONG GUCK ON United States citizen son of WONG SICK HONG. He left the United States on 8/20/33 from San Pedro, California and returned through the same port on 7/5/36. File contarins copy of affdiavit made by Ben Nung WONG on 9/11/68 in which he testified that he is a native and citizen of China and in which he identified SUBJECT as his blood and also his immigration brother. SUBJECT made an affidavit on 10/23/68 in which he testified his name is Ben Dong WONG. That he was born on 1/22/14 at Ping Lok Vil., HSD., China and that he is a citizen of China. That he was not related to his immigration father. In addition to entries shown in his file SUBJECT stated he had left the United States about November 1948 and returned through Honolulu on 8/31/49. He surrendered U. S. Passport No. FOIA (b)(6) issued to WONG GUCK ON on 10/13/48 which contains endorsement showing bearers admission to the U. S. at Honolulu on 8/31/49. SUBJECT testified that he has never been inspected and admitted to the U. S. as an alien. SUBJECT testified that he married Suey Gee FONG in China in 1930. On his first entry he had reported he was single. That when he returned to the U. S. in 1936 he reported he had mar ied while on that trip to China. That he had petitioned for his wife as a citizen of the United Sttes and that she was immigrated on 9/1/49. That he lives with his wife. That he and his wife have three childenn Don Lem WONG born in China in 1934 and now living at 2625 Wilshire Blvd., Santa Monica, California. William and Harry who were born in Los Angeles and who live with SUBJECT. SUBJECT has submitted an application for status as a permanent resident under provisions of Section 249 of the I. & N. Act. The case will be forwarded to the Travel Control Branch, Los Angeles for adjudication. FORM G-166 (REV. 7-1-64) FPI-LPC-5-66-23M-2530
